Description:
Detects uncommon "userinit.exe" child processes, which could be a sign of uncommon shells or login scripts used for persistence.

Author: Tom Ueltschi (@c_APT_ure), Tim Shelton
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Uncommon Userinit Child Process
Query: sourcetype='windows-sysmon' eql select * from _source_ where (parent_process_path like '%\userinit.exe' and  not process_path like '%:\windows\explorer.exe' and  not (process_path = 'null' or (command like '%netlogon.bat%' or command like '%usrlogon.cmd%') or command = 'powershell.exe' or (process_path like '%:\windows\system32\proquota.exe' or process_path like '%:\windows\syswow64\proquota.exe') or (process_path like '%:\program files (x86)\citrix\hdx\bin\cmstart.exe' or process_path like '%:\program files (x86)\citrix\hdx\bin\icast.exe' or process_path like '%:\program files (x86)\citrix\system32\icast.exe' or process_path like '%:\program files\citrix\hdx\bin\cmstart.exe' or process_path like '%:\program files\citrix\hdx\bin\icast.exe' or process_path like '%:\program files\citrix\system32\icast.exe')))
